subject: Re: Neurodiversity storyboard v1
body:
Hi Randall,
I share the link over the chat.
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 10:36 PM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hi Arvin,
Just curious if you have an expected turnaround for the first draft of the development of the module.  
Thank you!
Randy
From:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 11:30:21 AM
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>; Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hi Randall,
Thankyou and I will be working on designing part.
Regards,
Arvinder
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 7:27 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and not having seen the course, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

I know...a lot of emails today - but it's been a busy day! 
🙂
 
Feb.16 marks Chuck's 5-year work anniversary at LCW. 
In the past half-decade, Chuck has guided LCW (and us) with wisdom, vision, and an impressive vocabulary that keeps us all reaching for a dictionary. His strategic thinking, dedication, and ability to inspire have made a lasting impact on our team and the work we do.
Please join us in congratulating Chuck on this milestone! Congrats Chuck! 
🎉
Cheers,
Nicole

Subject:
 Farewell Catalina & Welcome Jorgelina (Lina) - Translation Coordinator
 
Hi all,
 
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 
🙁
. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
 
Welcome Lina!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer

subject: Farewell Catalina & Welcome Jorgelina (Lina) - Translation Coordinator
body:
Hi all,
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 🙁. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
Welcome Lina!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)

From:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Friday, February 14, 2025 12:57 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Questions about building new Microlearnings
 
 
Hello Nicole,
I am doing good. Hope you are also fine.
Below are the responses to your questions.
1.What courses have you been asked to deliver?
Response:
I have been asked for micro learning and spotlight courses (first draft done by me and waiting for Andrea and Chuck feedbacks)
For spotlight , I have done for Neuro diversity and Randall is working with me.
a) Do these courses have deadlines for completion?
Response:
Not sure, but I do need to know the timeline.
b) Are any courses priority over others?
Response:
Priority is microlearning and spotlights
2. How long does it take you, on average, to turn an existing LCW training (from PPT) into an elearning or microloearning?
Response:
eLearning takes more time compare to microlearning.
3.Are you using Rise or Storyline?
Response:
I use Rise for microlearning and Storyline for eLearning courses.
4. How long would it take you, on average, to create a new microlearning from scratch (assuming the course is around 30 minutes or less)?
For an average microlearning course will take 25-30 hours 30 mins courses. It can be less as well, if I provided with images.
You can assume someone from LCW would work with you on the content, as a subject matter expert
5.Does Rise and/or Storyline allow for translation into other languages?
If Yes, is this something you can do? (We would have professional translators review for accuracy)
If No, do you know of a workaround (ex: translating outside of Rise/Storyline & then importing the translation)
Response
It is possible in both, just I need translation document and voiceover.it takes 50-60% time with comparing to original time taken for English language. But it is not too tough. I can do easily
Please let me know if you need anything else
Thanks,
Arvin

subject: Re: Neurodiversity storyboard v1
body:
Hi Randall,
Thankyou and I will be working on designing part.
Regards,
Arvinder
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 7:27 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Neurodiversity storyboard v1
 
 
Hey Rebecca,
Attached is the current draft version of the neurodiversity elearning that I re-worked (mostly by changing the order of some things, adding some narration to introduce “slides”, etc.)
 
There are, however, a few spots (highlighted in yellow) where I have doubts about the value/reasoning behind things.  Can you take a quick look at my highlights and see if there is anything you can add or share?  Also, my narration is draft – and not having seen the course, I’m not sure if there is a better or more robust way to perhaps introduce an idea or concept. Any tweaks you might have, at this stage, would also be welcome. Unlike a video, luckily, changing the narration at any point is really easy, as it doesn’t modify the timing of animations or anything.
 
Hey Arvinder,
As Rebecca reviews this, feel free to get started on building out the first version of the course (it’s also saved in your inbox folder, of course). Changes to narration should not have a huge impact.  There are several places where an interactive learning activity is needed – I have not dictated what type they should be, so please design/develop your best ideas and we can connect after.
 
Any questions, please let me know!
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
Advisor

Subject:

Howdy folks!
 
I'll be out of the office (technically) from this Fri to next Wed (back in the office Thurs. Feb.13). That said, I will be able to answer emails & will be doing work. I just might not be able to respond as quickly as I normally do.
 
I know there are some of you I will be communicating with for urgent matters (Larry & Kaitlin - about the Feb.11 webinar, Catalina - about your replacement). I will be available for anything urgent - just tell me it's urgent, and I'll respond 
🙂
.
 
So while I'm away, I will be available if you need me 
🙂
.
 
Thanks lovely people!

From:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, February 6, 2025 9:03 PM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Storyboard v1
 
 
Hi Arvinder,
In light of the fact that there is no better transcript to base the elearning on, I have created a Storyboard v1 doc that will rely exclusively on the speakers notes *
AND

subject: I'll be OOO
body:
Howdy folks!
I'll be out of the office (technically) from this Fri to next Wed (back in the office Thurs. Feb.13). That said, I will be able to answer emails & will be doing work. I just might not be able to respond as quickly as I normally do.
I know there are some of you I will be communicating with for urgent matters (Larry & Kaitlin - about the Feb.11 webinar, Catalina - about your replacement). I will be available for anything urgent - just tell me it's urgent, and I'll respond 🙂.
So while I'm away, I will be available if you need me 🙂.
Thanks lovely people!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

body:
Dear all,
 
Chuck, Juri and I had a call with Claudia  ( ColPal Hr) today and she announced that they will delay the project by a few weeks (Date TBD) as discussions internally are taking place regarding new DEI initiatives pushed back since 01/20/25 new US government administration which is rather radical but impacting government funded programs. Colpal is impacted they say. 
Ending Radical And Wasteful Government DEI Programs And Preferencing – The White House
 
Next steps:
 
Chuck will follow up mid-February.
Juri ‘s timeline is ready and awaiting ColPal input.( It has been shared, in agreement during call)
ML development will be led by Nicole and Keri. 
Patricia is transitioning to external facilitator and coaching engagements ONLY effective immediately. 
Please direct any questions to Chuck and Nicole
 
Thank you everyone!
 
Patricia M Coleman

Subject:

Good morning, Evening ladies,
 
Here is client’s response (Claudia/HR). Chuck advised we will discuss on ALL STAFF MEETING TODAY.
Indeed, tittle MATTERS. Glad we caught it.
 
 
Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?  
Current employees
 
See you at the meeting!
 
Best,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman

Sr Consultant  
LCW

subject: RE: COLPALNEW  ML TIMELINE DUE TODAY  following client's meeting and response -: Work Breakdown: ColPal Micro Learning/ Rewards & Recognition
body:
Hello Juri,
Thanks for the proposed schedule.
In order for me to confirm everything, I would need information about the exact scope.
I understand you will need:
Translation of English approved content. In which languages? The 5 we did before?
How many total word? Do you estimate around 5000 like the ones we did before?
Are there any PDF that will need translation?
Do you have the English video you can share with me so I can quote English VO?
Will you need other languages VO and subtitle?
I would be able to confirm on translation timeline and VO/Subtitle timeline. But cannot guarantee on implementation (putting all localized content on the microlearning) since that, according to what I understand, would be in the hands of Arvinder.
 
Please let me know and I would work on it ASAP. I would send you cost and TAT estimate.
Thanks!
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Indeed, tittle MATTERS. Glad we caught it.
 
 
Hello Patricia :
 
I am copying Jesma to bring her into the loop & please see my comments in blue to your questions:
 
1.
   
First, as I am reviewing original SOW to determine budget. I see that tittle is “Managing Bias in Compensation & Recognition" vs “Rewards & Recognition”. The latter came up during our last call. Recognition=Praises, email, public announcements but Rewards= Tangible perks in addition to salary. When discuss goals, objectives and outcomes expected we can confirm. 
I will say we should  keep the title as Managing Bias in Rewards & Recogntion" since internally we usually talk about Rewards & Recognition and not Compensation & Recognition but  we will definitely discuss the  specific content to be included.
2.
   
We spoke about Q1 to work on this ML. Do you have launch date in mind in Q1 or Q2? 
The sooner the better , so ideally Q1 still not an specific date
3.
   
Who will benefit from this ML, current employees, or new hire ONLY?  
Current employees
 
See you at the meeting!
 
Best,

subject: Re: Religious Inclusion
body:
Hi Chuck,
Could you please clarify these, so that I can start working on that.
Thanks,
Arvin
From:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, January 9, 2025 11:06 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Religious Inclusion
 
 
Hi Chuck,
Thank you for the details. Based on your suggestion, here’s my recommendation:
We can create one module comprising four lessons, each with a duration of 8–10 minutes. This approach will ensure the content remains engaging and digestible while covering the full scope of Neurodiversity.
I also wanted to confirm a few points to align with your expectations:
When you mention a design document, are you referring to compiling the content along with draft designs in a PPT format? Could you please elaborate on this?
The content currently shared in the PPT seems insufficient for a 30–40-minute module. Would you like me to use the same content as is, or should I expand on it?
Looking forward to your clarification to proceed accordingly.
Thanks,
Arvin
From:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, January 9, 2025 10:19 PM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Religious Inclusion
 
 
Yes.
These are the in-person Spotlights that that we want to transition to elearnings. The question outstanding is about whether a Neurodiversity elearning module ends up being a single 30-40 minute module or a module made up of multiple 8-10 minute microlearnings.
 
You can work on the design document. We will have a SME provide you with feedback. Once we have that approved we can move to storyboarding.
 
I’ve attached a storyboard example from a previous elearning to illustrate what the team is used to. It DOES NOT mean you need to use this exact format but being able to see what will display on the screen, what will be narrated (from the instructor note in the deck), and any interactivity or content branches visually will help them provide you with feedback.
 
Again, you don’t have to use the format in the attached example, but the visual will help them once we get to that point.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Chuck
 
Chuck Adams
 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
LCW

+1.773.938.4285
Mobile: +1.630.373.5068

Thanks,
 
 
I will work on the same order. Is this design document for Articulate storyline?
 
 
Thanks

>

subject: Re: Religious Inclusion
body:
Hi Chuck,
Thank you for the details. Based on your suggestion, here’s my recommendation:
We can create one module comprising four lessons, each with a duration of 8–10 minutes. This approach will ensure the content remains engaging and digestible while covering the full scope of Neurodiversity.
I also wanted to confirm a few points to align with your expectations:
When you mention a design document, are you referring to compiling the content along with draft designs in a PPT format? Could you please elaborate on this?
The content currently shared in the PPT seems insufficient for a 30–40-minute module. Would you like me to use the same content as is, or should I expand on it?
Looking forward to your clarification to proceed accordingly.
Thanks,
Arvin

subject: Bill pay process update for 2025
body:
Hi everyone! As promised, here is what you need to know about our bill pay process change. We will stop using Bill.com at the end of January, and are switching to QuickBooks Bill Pay (an Intuit brand). This is cheaper for the company, and offers better integration for my work. (Payroll for full-timers is not changing – this affects contractor and vendor payments only.)
 
Part-time and external consultants:
You should have already gotten an email from me and from Intuit to set up your free QuickBooks Money account so you can keep getting ACH payments. I can also input information manually if necessary.
Please be sure you are sending your time sheets/invoices to your approver (Chuck or Nicole) ONLY. They will then send it to me for processing (this prevents confusion and duplicates).
If you have any questions about your pay, please email Accounting or ping me in Teams.
 
Salaried folks who have expenses and get reimbursements: 
Please continue sending your expense reports to Accounting ONLY as normal. Any reimbursements will be added into your paychecks instead of handled separately.
 
If you are an approver of vendor invoices: 
Please send the PDF invoice to 
lcw+expenses@assist.intuit.com
 and copy Accounting. The Intuit address is a bot inside the accounting software, so I need to also have it in my regular email in case it skips important things! 
For questions or reminders about bills, please only email Accounting.
Since it takes a few days minimum to set folks up in the new system, please be sure to send vendor invoices in a timely manner. 
Domestic vendors will get an email from me and Intuit after I get their first bill in the new system to set up their ACH payment account. 
Vendors currently getting international wires, I will email to discuss options. Vendors on PayPal will not have any changes.
 
Any questions or problems, please let me know!
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW
Email: 
accounting@lcwmail.com
PS: LCW will be closed December 24 through January 1. Wishing you Happy Holidays!

subject: Re: HAPPY NEW YEAR! Never too late for good wishes!
body:
Hi Patricia,
Happy New Year to you and the entire LCW family!
Thank you for sharing these lovely insights about New Year traditions across cultures—it’s such a beautiful reminder of how meaningful and diverse celebrations can be.
Thanks,
Arvin
From:
 Patricia Coleman <p.coleman@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Saturday, January 4, 2025 3:01 AM
To:
 Office <office@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 HAPPY NEW YEAR! Never too late for good wishes!
 
 
 
Hello and welcome to  2025,
 
I trust you had a good holiday break…but wait,  it is NOT over!
 
Did you know???
 
Most western countries say HAPPY NEW YEAR at midnight the evening of December 3st, into the first few days on January.
 
In France we actually will send “hand written” cards or make phone calls to dear ones throughout the month on January. We reach out intentionally and mindfully.
 
If this is not your custom, guess what: We get a chance to say HAPPY NEW YEAR at the end of January as LUNAR YEAR is on the 29
th
 this year.
 
Lunar year know to many as Chinese New Year is celebrated by many Asian countries.
 
Happy New Year is Chinese is: 
Gōngx
ǐ
 f
ā
c
á
i 
and it means  “Wishing you prosperity”!
 
 
Wishing the LCW family a very prosperous year!
 
Happy New Year! Bonne année! ¡Feliz Año Nuevo! Feliz Ano Novo!  Frohes neues Jahr! Felice anno nuovo!  Sanah Jadidah Saeidah! Heri ya Mwaka Mpya!
 
 
Have a great weekend!
 
All the best,
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW

subject: Re: Hello - Project Information
body:
Hi Chuck,
Are we meeting
From:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Saturday, December 21, 2024 3:17 AM
To:
 Arvinder Kaur <a.kaur@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Hello - Project Information
 
 
Namaste, Arvin – 
 
Checking to see if you got this email and to ensure you have access to the Dropbox folder for your work.
https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/vea07suyqdq3m4kog7kyt/AMRsqF6wDOgXx0R88JJVLQ8?rlkey=i5u3d907i7ows29hff6jvppii&st=w53pux9s&dl=0
 
You should have permissions to this folder. The Inbox will have the materials for you to work on. You’ll find a few files in there already. When finished you can put your output in the Outbox folder.
 
 
Let’s start with the Religious Inclusion micro-learning. I would like you to develop and share a design document for how you would build this as a 10-15 minute microlearning in Rise. Once we get past that one we can focus on the elearning transitions.
 
The classroom deck to elearning transitions will be competed as 30-35 minute modules in Storyline. It is okay to put additional information on a ‘Want to know More’ branch but the main branch should be 30-35 minutes. I will need design documents for each of the sessions to show the SME for review before we start programming.
 
The order of the transition will be:
Neurodiversity
Black Community
Women in Leadership
Generations
People with Disability 
 
I figure this will take a few weeks for design, review, development, testing. It will be a good place to start. Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Best,
 
Chuck
 
Please Note: Honoring the need for work/life balance, LCW will be closed for Winter Break from December 24 through January 1st. Happy Holidays to you and yours!
 
Chuck Adams
 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer

subject: Automatic reply: Welcome Arvin! LCW's New Instructional Designer
body:
Hello LCW Team,
 
I am abroad for the holidays  through January 3rd. 
 
While abroad, I plan to check emails after Chirstmas and before New Year's  Eve.  
 
For anyone wishing to connect!  I will be on Atlantic time/ +2 hrs CST/+1hr EST.   Best to contact me via WHATSAPP for urgent matters + 561 789 0337. ( I DO NOT HAVE TEAMS or EMAIL on my cell)
 
I wish you a MERRY CHRISTMAS, HAPPY HANUKKAH and KWANZAA...and NOT YET HAPPY NEW YEAR as per French tradition ;-) and see you on in January 2025 
 
Sincerely,
 
Patricia AKA PMC :-)

subject: Re: NDA returned
body:
Hi Arvinder,
Nice to meet you as well. Glad to have you with us!
I'll be officially announcing you soon, so look out for that email 🙂.
A few questions / things we need from you. Please note I'm new to UpWork, so thanks in advance for your patience 🙂. 
Kindly sign and return the W8-BEN form that I added in UpWork. I am not sure if this is something that is already in UpWork. This form is something that is required for us to have on file. You may be familiar with it.
Please confirm the hours you will be working. We have some folks on CST (Chicago time) and some on EST (New Jersey, Florida time)
Also, please let me know if it's easier to communicate in UpWork.
Thanks & looking forward to working with you!
Nicole
